statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

header.gameNote: SOUTHLAND CONF TR AT HOUSTON TX

article.headline: Texas A&M-Corpus Christi 87, McNeese State 66
article.story: HOUSTON (AP) -- Cedric Smith scored 16 points and Kevin Menifee added 13 for top-seeded Texas A&M-Corpus Christi, which beat McNeese State 87-66 Friday night to advance to the Southland Conference championship game. Texas A&M-Corpus Christi (25-6), the regular-season league champion in its first season in the conference, will play No. 3 seed Northwestern State in Sunday's final. Northwestern State defeated Lamar 78-65 in the first semifinal Friday. League Player of the Year Chris Daniels, a 7-0 center, added 12 points for the Islanders, who have won 19 of their last 21 games. The Islanders were 37-of-44 from the free throw line. McNeese made 13-of-20 free throws. McNeese (15-17) was led by Jarvis Bradley's 25 points. He was 11-of-15 from the floor. John Ford scored 13, and Troy Aaron added 11 for the Cowboys, who were trying to advance to the tournament final for the first time since 2002, when they won it and moved on to the NCAA Tournament. McNeese scored 42 points in the paint, but was 1-of-14 on 3-pointers. Texas A&M-Corpus Christi will attempt to make its first NCAA appearance with a win Sunday.
